## :clipboard: Logistics

### Lectures and workshops

This course meets for two hours each week. This two-hour interval will be divided into 1) lecture and 2) a hands-on workshop component. In the workshop we will work together through a practical aspect of phonetics and phonology research.

-   There will usually be about 1 hour for lecture and 1 hour for workshop, though this may vary from week to week.
-   There is also an **extra workshop** each week, which is **optional** and is an opportunity to work through the workshop materials if you do not finish them in lecture, or have outstanding questions.

Lecture place and time: **Tuesday 14:10-16:00** \~ S.1 - 7 George Square

Extra workshop place and time: **Thursday 10:00-10:50** \~ 3.10 Dugald Stewart Building

### Office hours

Monday 10:00-12:00, booked here: <https://jeremysteffman.youcanbook.me>

Go to this page and choose a time slot for a meeting. If you don't book a meeting I may not be there!

Location: my office 2.13 Dugald Stewart Building

## :bookmark: Assessment: *Portfolio* *\~* **due 11th December 2025 12:00**

The final assessment will be released to you at the end of week 5. It is an accumulated portfolio that you are encouraged to build **throughout the latter half of the semester.** The idea is that you can incrementally build and complete most of your portfolio before the end of week 10. There are some bits covered in the final two lectures which you will have to wait to complete, but all other components can be completed by week 8.

-   The assessment is submitted electronically on a portal on Learn, which will appear on the course page.

## :books: Readings and weekly exercises

You are expected to complete weekly readings which will reinforce concepts from Lecture. The text books we will read from are below. Both are available to you online through the [library](https://discovered.ed.ac.uk/discovery/search?vid=44UOE_INST:44UOE_VU2) and there are some physical copies which can be checked out.

-   Ladefoged, Peter, and Keith Johnson. *A Course in Phonetics.* Seventh edition. Australia: Cengage Learning, 2015.

-   Zsiga, Elizabeth C. *The Sounds of Language: An Introduction to Phonetics and Phonology.* Chichester, West Sussex: Wiley-Blackwell, 2013. (n.b. there is a newer edition but we are using the 2013 one)

## :white_check_mark: Your weekly tasks

1.  Attend lecture and work on the workshop for the week.

    -   Complete the workshop materials, if not finished within the lecture time frame.
    -   Optionally attend the extra workshop to do this and ask questions.

2.  Complete all readings for the week - these will generally reinforce what has been covered in lecture, and will in some cases go beyond the lecture content.

    -   You can finish the readings for a week anytime before the **next** **week's** lecture.

3.  Complete additional practice exercises and explore additional resources which will be posted as **weekly practice resources** on each week's section on Learn. These will be short and are intended to get you engaging more actively with the lecture material.

4.  **Week 5 onward**: spend some time working on the portfolio assessment, suggested time is 2 hours per week.
